query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Di nova pena mi conven far versi 2 e dar matera al ventesimo canto 3 de la prima canzon, ch’è d’i sommersi.
query.error: **English:** 1 Of new pain I must make verses 2 and give material for the twentieth canto 3 of the first song, which is of those submerged.
query.result: 1 Be neowe sare ic sceal feorsian leoð 2 and syllan wyrda ðam twentigoðan sang 3 ðære forman leod, ðe is be ðam forswollendum.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 Io era già disposto tutto quanto 5 a riguardar ne lo scoperto fondo, 6 che si bagnava d’angoscioso pianto;
query.error: **English:** 4 I was already disposed, wholly, 5 to gaze into the depths revealed, 6 which were bathed in anguished tears;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 e vidi gente per lo vallon tondo 8 venir, tacendo e lagrimando, al passo 9 che fanno le letane in questo mondo.
query.error: **English:** 7 and I saw people coming through the round valley, 8 silently weeping and moving at the pace 9 of litanies in this world.
query.result: 7 and ic geseah ða leode on ðam deopan wæle 8 cuman, swygende and wepende, on ðam siðe 9 ðe ða letanias on ðysse worulde doð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 Come ’l viso mi scese in lor più basso, 11 mirabilmente apparve esser travolto 12 ciascun tra ’l mento e ’l principio del casso,
query.error: **English:** 10 As my gaze descended to their lower parts, 11 I saw, wondrous to behold, that each of them 12 was twisted between the chin and the beginning of the chest,
query.result: 10 Swa ða min sceаwung on ða læssan læg, 11 wundorlice ðuhte ða gewriðen 12 æghwilc betwux ðam cinne and ðam breoste,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 ché da le reni era tornato ’l volto, 14 e in dietro venir li convenia, 15 perché ’l veder dinanzi era lor tolto.
query.error: **English:** 13 for their faces were turned toward their backs, 14 and they were forced to walk backward, 15 because they were unable to see in front of them.
query.result: 13 ðæt ða hrycg wæs ðær ða neb sceolde beon, 14 and ða eaxla ðær ða eagan sceoldon beon, 15 forðæm ðe ðæt gesihð him wæs beæftan benumen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 Forse per forza già di parlasia 17 si travolse così alcun del tutto; 18 ma io nol vidi, né credo che sia.
query.error: **English:** 16 Perhaps by force of paralysis 17 someone was so completely turned around; 18 but I did not see him, nor do I believe it is so.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Se Dio ti lasci, lettor, prender frutto 20 di tua lezione, or pensa per te stesso 21 com’ io potea tener lo viso asciutto,
query.error: **English:** 19 If God lets you, reader, take fruit 20 from your reading, now think for yourself 21 how I could keep my face dry,
query.result: 19 Gif ðe God læteð, ðu lærend, brucan 20 ðinre lare, ðonne ðence ðe self 21 hu ic mihte ðone wlitegan wætan,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 quando la nostra imagine di presso 23 vidi sì torta, che ’l pianto de li occhi 24 le natiche bagnava per lo fesso.
query.error: **English:** 22 when I saw our image so twisted nearby, 23 that the tears from my eyes 24 bathed its buttocks through the crack.
query.result: 22 ða ða ure anlicnes ic neawest 23 geseah swa gedreht, ðæt ðara eagena tear 24 ða næssas baðeð ðurh ða brade rift.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Certo io piangea, poggiato a un de’ rocchi 26 del duro scoglio, sì che la mia scorta 27 mi disse: «Ancor se’ tu de li altri sciocchi?
query.error: **English:** 25 Certainly I wept, leaning against one of the rocks 26 of the hard cliff, so that my guide 27 said to me: "Are you still one of the other fools?
query.result: 25 Soðlice ic weop, hliniende wið ænne ðara stanclifu 26 ðæs heardan clifes, swa ðæt min lædesmann 27 cwæð to me: "Eart ðu gyt of ðam oðrum dysigum?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 Qui vive la pietà quand’ è ben morta; 29 chi è più scellerato che colui 30 che al giudicio divin passion comporta?
query.error: **English:** 28 Here pity lives when it is quite dead; 29 who is more wicked than he who endures 30 suffering in the divine judgment?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Drizza la testa, drizza, e vedi a cui 32 s’aperse a li occhi d’i Teban la terra; 33 per ch’ei gridavan tutti: “Dove rui,
query.error: **English:** 31 Raise your head, raise it, and see to whom 32 the earth opened itself before the eyes of the Thebans; 33 because of which they all cried out: "Where are you rushing,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Anfïarao? perché lasci la guerra?”. 35 E non restò di ruinare a valle 36 fino a Minòs che ciascheduno afferra.
query.error: **English:** 34 Amphiaraus? Why do you leave the war?". 35 And he did not stop his fall 36 until he reached Minos, who seizes everyone.
query.result: 34 Amfiaraus? Hwi forlætst ðu ðone wig?". 35 And he ne geswac ðæs hryres to ðære helle 36 oð ðæt he com to ðam Minos ðe gehæfteð ælcne.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Mira c’ha fatto petto de le spalle; 38 perché volle veder troppo davante, 39 di retro guarda e fa retroso calle.
query.error: **English:** 37 See how he has made a chest of his shoulders; 38 because he wanted to see too far ahead, 39 he looks behind and goes backward.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 Vedi Tiresia, che mutò sembiante 41 quando di maschio femmina divenne, 42 cangiandosi le membra tutte quante;
query.error: **English:** 40 See Tiresias, who changed appearance 41 when from male he became female, 42 changing all of his members;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 e prima, poi, ribatter li convenne 44 li duo serpenti avvolti, con la verga, 45 che rïavesse le maschili penne.
query.error: **English:** 43 and first, then, it was necessary for him to strike again 44 the two entwined serpents, with the rod, 45 so that he might have back his male parts.
query.result: 43 and eft ða ða næddran twegen 44 mid ðære gyrde ofsloh, ða wearð he eft to were, 45 and hæfde ða weres hiw eft.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 Aronta è quel ch’al ventre li s’atterga, 47 che ne’ monti di Luni, dove ronca 48 lo Carrarese che di sotto alberga,
query.error: **English:** 46 Aronta is he who turns his back to the belly, 47 who in the mountains of Luni, where the Carrarese, 48 who dwells below, quarries,
query.result: 46 Aronta is se ðe ðam wombe on bæc lið, 47 se ðe on ðam muntum Luni, ðær se Carrarese, 48 se ðe ðær neoðan eardiað, hacað,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 ebbe tra ’ bianchi marmi la spelonca 50 per sua dimora; onde a guardar le stelle 51 e ’l mar non li era la veduta tronca.
query.error: **English:** 49 had his cave among the white marbles 50 for his dwelling; whence to watch the stars 51 and the sea his view was not cut off.
query.result: 49 hæfde betwux ðam hwitan marman his spelunc 50 for his wununge; ðanon to locian ða steorran 51 and ða sæ him ða gesyhð ne wæs forcorfen.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 E quella che ricuopre le mammelle, 53 che tu non vedi, con le trecce sciolte, 54 e ha di là ogne pilosa pelle,
query.error: **English:** 52 And she who covers her breasts, 53 which you do not see, with her hair flowing loose, 54 and has every part of her skin hairy,
query.result: 52 And ðæt ðe ða breoste bewrigen hæfð, 53 ðe ðu ne gesihst, mid ðam losigen hæran, 54 and hæfð ðone felhagan æghwylcne lim,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
58 Poscia che ’l padre suo di vita uscìo 59 e venne serva la città di Baco, 60 questa gran tempo per lo mondo gio.
query.error: **English:** 58 After his father departed from life 59 and the city of Bacchus became a slave, 60 this [city] wandered through the world for a long time.
query.result: 58 Siððan his fæder of life gewất 59 and wearð Bacus ceastre ðeow, 60 seo ða lange tid ofer werþeod wæg.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
61 Suso in Italia bella giace un laco, 62 a piè de l’Alpe che serra Lamagna 63 sovra Tiralli, c’ha nome Benaco.
query.error: **English:** 61 Up in beautiful Italy lies a lake, 62 at the foot of the Alps that enclose Germany, 63 above the Tyrol, which is called Benaco.
query.result: 61 Uppon on ðære fægeran Italie ligeð an mere, 62 æt ðæs muntes fot ðe ða mæran beorgas beluceð, 63 ofer ða Tyrolas, ðe is Benaco nemned.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
64 Per mille fonti, credo, e più si bagna 65 tra Garda e Val Camonica e Pennino 66 de l’acqua che nel detto laco stagna.
query.error: **English:** 64 Through a thousand springs, I believe, and more it is fed 65 between Garda and Val Camonica and Pennine 66 from the water that stagnates in the said lake.
query.result: 64 ðurh ðusend wælla, ic wene, and ma siho bið gefeded 65 betwux Garda and Wælle Combe and Penig 66 of ðæm wætere ðe on ðæm sæde mere standeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
67 Loco è nel mezzo là dove ’l trentino 68 pastore e quel di Brescia e ’l veronese 69 segnar poria, s’e’ fesse quel cammino.
query.error: **English:** 67 The place is in the middle where the Trentine 68 shepherd and he of Brescia and the Veronese 69 could give their blessing, if they made that journey.
query.result: 67 Þæt stow is on midde þær se Trenta 68 hyrde and se of Brescia and se Veronesa 69 mihton tacen gewyrcan, gif hie þone weg ferdon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
70 Siede Peschiera, bello e forte arnese 71 da fronteggiar Bresciani e Bergamaschi, 72 ove la riva ’ntorno più discese.
query.error: **English:** 70 Peschiera sits, a beautiful and strong fortress, 71 to confront the Brescians and Bergamasques, 72 where the shore descends more around.
query.result: 70 Sitt Peschiera, fæger and fæst geweorc, 71 to bewerienne Brescia and Bergamascas, 72 ðær ðæs ofer’s ymbhwyrft ma gehnægeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
73 Ivi convien che tutto quanto caschi 74 ciò che ’n grembo a Benaco star non può, 75 e fassi fiume giù per verdi paschi.
query.error: **English:** 73 There it is necessary that everything fall 74 that cannot stay in Benaco's lap, 75 and it becomes a river down through green pastures.
query.result: 73 Þær hit gebyreð ðæt ealnig gewíteð 74 ðæt ðe on Benacaes bearm ne mæg, 75 and wyrðeð ea niðer of grene leage.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
76 Tosto che l’acqua a correr mette co, 77 non più Benaco, ma Mencio si chiama 78 fino a Governol, dove cade in Po.
query.error: **English:** 76 As soon as the water begins to flow, 77 it is no longer called Benaco, but Mincio, 78 as far as Governolo, where it falls into the Po.
query.result: 76 Swa sona swa ðæt wæter to rinnanne onginð, 77 nis hit na leng Benaco, ac Mencio hit is haten 78 oð Governol, ðær hit on Po gefealleð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
79 Non molto ha corso, ch’el trova una lama, 80 ne la qual si distende e la ’mpaluda; 81 e suol di state talor essere grama.
query.error: **English:** 79 He had not gone far when he found a marsh, 80 in which he spread out and wallowed; 81 and in summer it is sometimes dry.
query.result: 79 Ne wæs ðær furður ðonne anes miles lengð, 80 ðæt he ne com to ðære læman, 81 and ðær he læg and ðær wunode.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
82 Quindi passando la vergine cruda 83 vide terra, nel mezzo del pantano, 84 sanza coltura e d’abitanti nuda.
query.error: **English:** 82 Then, passing by, the cruel maiden 83 saw land, in the middle of the marsh, 84 untilled and bare of inhabitants.
query.result: 82 Þa forðferde seo fæge fæmne 83 geseah ða land on midde ðæs meres, 84 untilad and unmanna wunigende.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
85 Lì, per fuggire ogne consorzio umano, 86 ristette con suoi servi a far sue arti, 87 e visse, e vi lasciò suo corpo vano.
query.error: **English:** 85 There, in order to flee all human company, 86 he stopped with his servants to practice his arts, 87 and he lived there and left his empty body there.
query.result: 85 Þær he for hogan fleah mannes man, 86 and wæs on wudu mid his werode, 87 and þær wunode and his wælstow forlet.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
88 Li uomini poi che ’ntorno erano sparti 89 s’accolsero a quel loco, ch’era forte 90 per lo pantan ch’avea da tutte parti.
query.error: **English:** 88 The men who were scattered all around 89 gathered at that place, which was strong 90 because of the marsh that surrounded it on all sides.
query.result: 88 Þa men þe ær wæron ymbutan tofaren 89 gesamnodon æt þam stede, se wæs fæst 90 for þam wætre þe wæs on ælce healfe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
91 Fer la città sovra quell’ ossa morte; 92 e per colei che ’l loco prima elesse, 93 Mantüa l’appellar sanz’ altra sorte.
query.error: **English:** 91 He made the city over those dead bones; 92 and because of her who first chose the place, 93 Mantua is its name, without other fate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
94 Già fuor le genti sue dentro più spesse, 95 prima che la mattia da Casalodi 96 da Pinamonte inganno ricevesse.
query.error: **English:** 94 Already his people were more thickly packed inside, 95 before the madness from Casalodi 96 received deceit from Pinamonte.
query.result: 94 Nu wæs his folc ðy ðiccure innan, 95 ær ðære dysige of Casalodi 96 fram Pinamonte pæne onfeng.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
97 Però t’assenno che, se tu mai odi 98 originar la mia terra altrimenti, 99 la verità nulla menzogna frodi».
query.error: **English:** 97 Therefore be assured that if you ever hear 98 my homeland described differently, 99 the truth is not deceived by any lie.
query.result: 97 Forðæm ðe ðu scealt ongitan ðæt, gif ðu æfre gehyrst 98 ænig oder ðin fæderland secgan, 99 ðæt ðæt soð næfre ðurh leasunge awent.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 E io: «Maestro, i tuoi ragionamenti 101 mi son sì certi e prendon sì mia fede, 102 che li altri mi sarien carboni spenti.
query.error: **English:** 100 And I: "Master, your arguments 101 are so certain to me and so win my faith, 102 that the others would be to me like dead coals.
query.result: 100 And ic: "Lareow, ðine rædas sind 101 swa gewisse and swa fæste min geleafa, 102 ðæt ða oðre wæron me swilce deade colan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Ma dimmi, de la gente che procede, 104 se tu ne vedi alcun degno di nota; 105 ché solo a ciò la mia mente rifiede».
query.error: **English:** 103 But tell me, of the people who are proceeding, 104 if you see any worthy of note; 105 for my mind is set on that alone».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 Allor mi disse: «Quel che da la gota 107 porge la barba in su le spalle brune, 108 fu—quando Grecia fu di maschi vòta,
query.error: **English:** 106 Then he said to me: "He who from his cheek 107 extends his beard over his brown shoulders, 108 was—when Greece was emptied of men,
query.result: 106 Þa he sæde: "Se ðe of ðære wange 107 þone beard ofer ða brunan eaxle 108 bær—ða Grecas wæron wera wædle,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 sì ch’a pena rimaser per le cune— 110 augure, e diede ’l punto con Calcanta 111 in Aulide a tagliar la prima fune.
query.error: **English:** 109 so that scarcely any remained in the cradles— 110 an augur, and gave the signal with Calchas 111 in Aulis to cut the first rope.
query.result: 109 swa ðæt æt ðam crætum cnapena ænig 110 læfde—wæs witega, and wísde ðone sige 111 on Aulis to ðære ærestan scipe."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Euripilo ebbe nome, e così ’l canta 113 l’alta mia tragedìa in alcun loco: 114 ben lo sai tu che la sai tutta quanta.
query.error: **English:** 112 His name was Euryphilus, and thus 113 my lofty tragedy sings of him in some place: 114 you know it well, for you know it all.
query.result: 112 Euryphilus wæs his nama, and swa hine nemneð 113 min hehsta sang on sumum stowe: 114 ðu hit watst wel, forðæm ðu hit eal can.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
115 Quell’ altro che ne’ fianchi è così poco, 116 Michele Scotto fu, che veramente 117 de le magiche frode seppe ’l gioco.
query.error: **English:** 115 That other one, who is so lean in the flanks, 116 was Michael Scot, who truly 117 knew the game of magical deceptions.
query.result: 115 Se ðe on ðam sidan is swa lyt, 116 ðæt wæs Michael Scot, ðe soðlice 117 ðara wicca gleawa gleawra wiste.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
118 Vedi Guido Bonatti; vedi Asdente, 119 ch’avere inteso al cuoio e a lo spago 120 ora vorrebbe, ma tardi si pente.
query.error: **English:** 118 See Guido Bonatti; see Asdente, 119 who now would like to have paid attention to the leather and the thread, 120 but he repents too late.
query.result: 118 Gesihð þu Gīðan Bōnatti; gesihð þu Āsendente, 119 þe nu woldon habban gehýred to ðǣm leðre and to ðǣm gærs, 120 ac hē ofhreowð tō læte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
121 Vedi le triste che lasciaron l’ago, 122 la spuola e ’l fuso, e fecersi ’ndivine; 123 fecer malie con erbe e con imago.
query.error: **English:** 121 See the wretched women who abandoned the needle, 122 the spool, and the spindle, and made themselves into witches; 123 they made spells with herbs and with images.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
124 Ma vienne omai, ché già tiene ’l confine 125 d’amendue li emisperi e tocca l’onda 126 sotto Sobilia Caino e le spine;
query.error: **English:** 124 But come now, for it already holds the boundary 125 of both hemispheres and touches the waves 126 beneath Seville, where Cain and the thorns are;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
127 e già iernotte fu la luna tonda: 128 ben ten de’ ricordar, ché non ti nocque 129 alcuna volta per la selva fonda».
query.error: **English:** 127 and already last night the moon was full: 128 you must remember it well, for it did not harm you 129 at any time through the deep forest.”
query.result: 127 and ða ða ilcan niht wæs ða mona ful: 128 ðu scealt ðæs wel gemunan, forðæm hit ðe ne derode 129 ænigre tide ðurh ðone wudu deopan.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
130 Sì mi parlava, e andavamo introcque.
query.error: **English:** 130 Thus he spoke to me, and we went on together.
query.result: 130 Swahemeclypode,andwetogædereodon.
